title: Domestic details
author: Crossrig, David Hume
snippet: 1696, disposed the lands of Crossrig and 4 lands of Edrom to George Home, younger of Wedderburn, he did at that time grant a back-bond to Robert Home, narrating that tho' the said disposition be irredeemable  and absolute, yet that the true cause of granting of the disposition was for money advanced, or to be advanced to Robert Home for carrying of the plea with me, whereof he being repayed, and of all he should expend for him, he obliged him to denude in favours of the said Robert, and the heirs lawfully to be procreate of his body.

title: Domestic details
author: Crossrig, David Hume
snippet: On the other part, I was ordained by the arbiters to discharge the said Robert Home of all personal! diligence, and to allow him the annualrent of the 4 lands of Edrom by way of aliment during his life, which I performed accordingly.

title: Domestic details
author: Crossrig, David Hume
snippet: which they pronounced their decreit arbitral  on July 19, 1698, and decerned the said Robert Home to ratify my right of apprysing, to discharge all process at his instance against me, to discharge the reversion  of the wodset granted by his grand mother and uncle to Sir John Home of Blackader, in anno 1636, and of new, to dispone to me the lands of Crossrig and 4 lands in Edrom ; as also to assign me to the mails and duties, and to old Wedderburn' s obligation in Nov'* 1678, and to young Wedderburn's backbond, narrating  a disposition be the said Robert Home to him, of the lands of Crossrig and 4 lands of Edrom, with the bygone rents of Crossrig since ann.

title: Domestic details
author: Crossrig, David Hume
snippet: Baptized at Edrom by Mr. Patrick Robison.

title: Domestic details
author: Crossrig, David Hume
snippet: I went to his burial at Edrom, and found in his cloaths, as I remember,  a list of debts owing to him and owing by him, the latter very far short of what 1 found it to be afterwards.
